column4: well, a 127 documented viruses for linux isn't none -- it always pays to make sure you aren't infected, better to be safe, than sorry afterwards
that does not enable or disable a service tho
if service is in init.d,then yes..else no
nope, you can stop a service that way, but when you change runlevels, it will be back up -- quite obviously because it is not disabled
do a chown on the file

and window managers are invoked by the user not root
